briefTitle: RCT to Evaluate the Efficacy of the NSSCEP in Reducing Burnout Among Jordanian Pediatric Oncology Nurses

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. A registered nurse (RN) employed in a paediatric oncology unit in for at least 6 months.
2. Willingness to participate in all aspects of the study, including interventions, questionnaires, and follow-up assessments.
3. Ability to understand and communicate in English
4. Have ability Self-reported experience of burnout related to their role as a paediatric oncology nurse.
5. Nurses provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Less than six months of experience in paediatric oncology
2. Non-registered nurses (e.g., nursing assistants or technicians)
3. Non-voluntary participation or inability to provide informed consent
4. Inability to communicate in English
5. Involvement in leadership roles or administrative positions

primary.measure: Reduction in Burnout Symptoms, improve Job satisfaction and missed nursing care
primary.description: This study evaluates the Nurses' Stress Self-Care Educational Program (NSSCEP) for Jordanian pediatric oncology nurses. The four-week program includes workshops on stress management, mindfulness, and coping strategies to reduce burnout and enhance well-being. Burnout, job satisfaction, and missed nursing care are assessed using validated tools: Professional Quality of Life Scale, Nurse Job Satisfaction Scale, and MISSCARE Survey. Higher scores indicate better outcomes. The study aims to support nurse mental health and improve care quality in Jordanian hospitals.
primary.timeFrame: Pre-intervention (baseline) and post-intervention (at 4 weeks, following completion of the educational sessions).

dataSource: ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 - Ultimate Complete Collection
